page.title: 08Ashchurch Army Camp 2
page.content: This is what happens to the vehicles when they come into the Central Vehicle Depot at Ashchurch.They are taken first to the kit stores;this is where they see if the vehicles have the right kit.For example, each vehicle must have an adjustable spanner, screw driver, pair of pliers, and a wheel bracket.Then they go to be inspected to see if they are roadworthy.If they are not,then they go into the camp's own workshop to be repaired .If the vehicles are new and are not roadworthy then the manufacturer has to come to do the repairs under warranty.If they are roadworthy, they are put into storage,either inside or outside, or sent to other bases. Some of the vehicles are moved by train especially the cranes.There are 11000 vehicles in the camp at the present time.
